title: Analytics Reports
subtitle: For Landing Lion's clients' marketing campaigns.
body: The goal of the reports are to provide Landing Lion clients with deep analytical exploration and discovery of their landing page campaigns. From there, LL clients' make dynamic decisions on their landing pages with the goal of improving conversion rate. To promote exploration I try to make the reports as immersive and smooth as possible. This is made possible by performing a lot of calculations up front and getting creative with several different client-side cache layers before the view renders. Additionally, no server-side requests are made once the view is rendered.

title: Visualizations
subtitle: Interactive data info-visualizations implemented in d3. It's modular, easily imported, and highly configurable.
body: The key difference between this visualization chartting library and the many that are out there is being able to configure a canvas of many charts and then link specified interactions together between different charts. I.e. hovering over a region on a choropleth to highlight a path on a line chart could be easily configured.

title: Asset Manager
subtitle: File manager and explorer angularJS submomdule. Easy to configure and drop into any angularJS web app.
body: We noticed a lot of projects we were working on required some sort of a file manager/explorer. To avoid a lot of extra work, I went ahead wrote a angularJS submodule that could be easily included in any angularJS project to accomplish this problem

title: TOMA
subtitle: Trackable Offline Marketing Automation
body: TOMA was a simple, small Google Chrome Extension for Real Estate websites to use to try to get valuable lead information from someone visiting their website. When a client connects to a website using TOMA, they are asked if they would like to see what houses sold for in there area. If they click yes, we then inform them that TOMA needs to permit the browser to get their location so we can see what houses in their area sold for. This allows the real estate agent to get the addresses of leads visiting their website so they can more accurately target them in their marketing efforts.

title: hunterbrennick.com
subtitle: Personal portfolio to showcase pieces of some projects I've built.

title: Mental Disorders
subtitle: Did you know we lose 25 vets a day to PTSD due to suicide? Our veterans need brand-based prescription anti-depressants to prevent this tragedy. Read all about it in Herb Wagemaker's book, Surviving PTSD.
body: Mentaldisorders.com is a website I built for my grandfather to help him market his book on PTSD

title: File Attacher
subtitle: Simple file manager used to upload and download patient files to onecare.me.
body: This is a full stack ASP.NET MVC web application with the goal of enabling users to manage their files on the onecare.me site.

title: Reliable Transfer Suite
subtitle: RTS is an abstraction layer over UDP, similar to TCP.
body: RTS is a reliable transport layer protocol written in Python. It multiplexes using an asynchronous IO loop.

title: JOS
subtitle: JOS is an MIT teaching Operating System with a mico-kernel architecture.
body: This project was completed for an Operating Systems class at Georgia Tech.

title: Geo News
subtitle: Existing news sites are flat, biased, and cluttered. People just want to know what's happening and where. Geo News does just that.
bodyTexts: Geo News is targeted for people with a demanding schedule that can't seem find time to stay up on current events, but still want to be in the loop. Geo News lets people quickly know whats happening and where. Geo News' articles are aggregated from a variety of major news sources. To filter out the noise and show news that matters the we interfaced with facebook and twitter to get social impact metrics. Articles over a certain social impact threshold are funneled through an ETL geo-locating system to be properly placed on the map.
involved: Dylan Jones, Sherman Mathews, Andrew Ford, Devon Cryts
